intro: Carum oreganum, commonly known as wild oregano, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, white to pale purple flowers and aromatic, pinnately compound leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its essential oils, rich in compounds like carvacrol and thymol, contribute to its strong fragrance and medicinal properties. Wild oregano is often used in culinary applications and traditional herbal remedies.
